info.title: RingCentral Connect Platform API
info.description: RingCentral API is a REST based interface, allowing to customize and integrate your phone system everywhere. It will help you build creative solutions based on our phone service and improve customer communications experience.

permissions.name: Glip
permissions.description: Availability of Glip

permissions.name: Accounts
permissions.description: Managing accounts: creating new accounts, viewing and updating account information, deleting existing accounts

permissions.name: Contacts
permissions.description: Creating, viewing, editing and deleting user personal contacts

permissions.name: EditAccounts
permissions.description: Viewing and updating user account info (including name, business name, address and phone number/account number)

permissions.name: EditCallLog
permissions.description: Viewing and updating user call logs

permissions.name: EditCustomData
permissions.description: Viewing and updating client custom data (key-value)

permissions.name: EditExtensions
permissions.description: Viewing and updating user extension info (includes extension name, number, email and phone number, assigned phone numbers, devices and other extension settings)

permissions.name: EditMessages
permissions.description: Viewing and updating user messages

permissions.name: Faxes
permissions.description: Sending and receiving faxes

permissions.name: InternalMessages
permissions.description: Sending and receiving intra-company text messages

permissions.name: Meetings
permissions.description: Creating, viewing, editing and deleting meetings

permissions.name: NumberLookup
permissions.description: Looking-up and reserving available phone number

permissions.name: ReadAccounts
permissions.description: Viewing user account info (including name, business name, address and phone number/account number)

permissions.name: ReadCallLog
permissions.description: Viewing user call logs

permissions.name: ReadCallRecording
permissions.description: Downloading call recording content

permissions.name: ReadClientInfo
permissions.description: Viewing of client application registered attributes and additional helper information (external URLs, hints, etc.)

permissions.name: ReadContacts
permissions.description: Viewing user personal contacts

permissions.name: ReadMessages
permissions.description: Viewing user messages

permissions.name: RingOut
permissions.description: Performing two-legged ring-out phone calls

permissions.name: ReadPresence
permissions.description: Getting user presence information

permissions.name: SMS
permissions.description: Sending and receiving SMS (text) messages

pathParameters.name: companyId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of an RC account/Glip company, or tilde (~) to indicate a company the current user belongs to

pathParameters.name: accountId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account logged-in within the current session

pathParameters.name: answeringRuleId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of an answering rule. The value can be standard digital ID or specific ID - either business-hours-rule or after-hours-rule

pathParameters.name: attachmentId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of a message attachment

pathParameters.name: blockedNumberId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of a blocked number list entry

pathParameters.name: brandId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of a brand

pathParameters.name: callLogId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of a call log record

pathParameters.name: companyPagerId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of a pager message

pathParameters.name: contactId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of a contact record in the RingCentral database

pathParameters.name: countryId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of a country

pathParameters.name: customDataKey
pathParameters.description: Custom data access key. The number of unique custom data keys is limited to 100 keys per extension, summarized for all the applications. For example, if you have created 50 custom data keys under the Android mobile client application for the particular extension, then loggedin the iOS application and created another 50 keys, the web client application won't be allowed to create any custom data key for that extension

pathParameters.name: departmentId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of a Department extension (same as extensionId but only the ID of a department extension is valid)

pathParameters.name: deviceId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of a device

pathParameters.name: extensionId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of an extension or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the currentsession

pathParameters.name: faxId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of a fax message

pathParameters.name: greetingId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of a greeting

pathParameters.name: groupId

pathParameters.name: languageId

pathParameters.name: lineId

pathParameters.name: meetingId

pathParameters.name: messageId

pathParameters.name: orderId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of an order

pathParameters.name: personId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of a user to be returned, the maximum number of IDs is 30

pathParameters.name: phoneNumberId
pathParameters.description: Internal identifier of a phone number

pathParameters.name: recordingId

pathParameters.name: ringoutId

pathParameters.name: scaleSize

pathParameters.name: secretQuestionId

requests.name: Get API Versions
requests.description: Returns current API version(s) and server info.

examples.name: Example
examples.request:
GET /restapi/ HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer U0pDMDFQMDFQQVMwMXxBQUFWZmY4ZXoxMlhvSmlGdjlQc1
examples.response:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Mon, 13 Oct 2014 13:24:10 GMT
RoutingKey: SJC01P01PAS01
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Language: en
Content-Length: 312

{
  "uri" : "https.../restapi/",
  "apiVersions" : [ {
    "uri" : "https.../restapi/v1.0",
    "versionString" : "1.0.14",
    "releaseDate" : "2014-10-31T00:00:00.000Z",
    "uriString" : "v1.0"
  } ],
  "serverVersion" : "7.0.0.551",
  "serverRevision" : "598ed4edcc56"
}

request.name: response_type
request.description: Must be set to code

request.name: client_id
request.description: Required. Enter your application key (Production or Sandbox) here

request.name: redirect_uri
request.description: Required. This is a callback URI which determines where the response will be sent to. The value of this parameter must exactly match one of the URIs you have provided for your app upon registration. This URI can be HTTP/HTTPS address for web applications or custom scheme URI for mobile or desktop applications.

request.name: state
request.description: Optional, recommended. An opaque value used by the client to maintain state between the request and callback. The authorization server includes this value when redirecting the user-agent back to the client. The parameter should be used for preventing cross-site request forgery

response.name: code
response.description: The authorization code returned for your application

response.name: expires_in
response.description: The remaining lifetime of the authorization code

response.name: state
response.description: This parameter will be included in response if it was specified in the client authorization request. The value will be copied from the one received from the client

request.name: token
request.description: Active access or refresh token to be revoked

request.name: grant_type
request.description: Must hold password value for Resource Owner Credentials flow. If client application is not authorized by the specified grant_type, response does not contain refresh_token and refresh_token_ttl attributes

request.name: access_token_ttl
request.description: Optional. Access token lifetime in seconds; the possible values are from 600 sec (10 min) to 3600 sec (1 hour). The default value is 3600 sec. If the value specified exceeds the default one, the default value is set. If the value specified is less than 600 seconds, the minimum value (600 sec) is set

request.name: refresh_token_ttl
request.description: Optional. Refresh token lifetime in seconds. The default value depends on the client application, but as usual it equals to 7 days. If the value specified exceeds the default one, the default value is applied. If client specifies refresh_token_ttl<=0, refresh token is not returned even if the corresponding grant type is supported

request.name: username
request.description: Phone number linked to account or extension in account in E.164 format with or without leading "+" sign

request.name: extension
request.description: Optional. Extension short number. If company number is specified as a username, and extension is not specified, the server will attempt to authenticate client as main company administrator

request.name: password
request.description: User's password

request.name: scope
request.description: Optional. List of API permissions to be used with access token (see Application Permissions). Can be omitted when requesting all permissions defined during the application registration phase

request.name: endpoint_id
request.description: Optional. Unique identifier of a client application. You can pass it in request according to pattern [a-zA-Z0-9_\-]{1,64}. Otherwise it is auto-generated by server. The value will be returned in response in both cases

requests.name: Create Account
requests.description: Creates the account in Initial state.

request.name: mainNumber
request.description: Main account VoIP phone number, either Local or Toll-Free. Cannot be Fax Only. Obtained via lookup/reserve API

request.name: operator
request.description: Operator's extension information. This extension will receive all calls and messages intended for the operator

request.name: partnerId
request.description: Partner identifier for this account

request.name: promotionCode
request.description: Promotion code to calculate a discount

request.name: reservationId
request.description: Internal identifier of phone number reservation; encoded data including reservation type (by brand, by account, by session), particular brand/account/session data, and reservation date and time

request.name: serviceInfo
request.description: Account service information, brand identifier and service plan

request.name: status
request.description: The status with which an account is created. The default value is 'Initial'

requests.name: Get Account Call Log
requests.description: Get Account Call Log Records by Filter

parameters.name: extensionNumber
parameters.description: Extension number of a user. If specified, returns call log for a particular extension only. Cannot be specified together with the phoneNumber filter

parameters.name: showBlocked
parameters.description: If 'True' then calls from/to blocked numbers are returned. The default value is 'True'

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: Phone number of a caller/call recipient. If specified, returns all calls (both incoming and outcoming) with the mentioned phone number. Cannot be specified together with the extensionNumber filter

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction for the result records. It is allowed to specify more than one direction. If not specified, both inbound and outbound records are returned. Multiple values are supported

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a call session. Cannot be specified along with parameters 'dateTo'/'dateFrom'

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Call type of a record. It is allowed to specify more than one type. If not specified, all call types are returned. Multiple values are supported

parameters.name: transport
parameters.description: Call transport type. By default this filter is disabled

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: The default value is 'Simple' for both account and extension call log

parameters.name: withRecording
parameters.description: 'True' if only recorded calls are returned. The default value is 'False'

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description: The start datetime for resulting records in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is dateTo minus 24 hours

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description: The end datetime for resulting records in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is current time

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are allowed. The default value is '1'

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). If not specified, the value is '100' by default.

examples.name: Example 1
examples.description: If the view parameter value is 'Simple'

examples.name: Example 2
examples.description: If the view parameter value is 'Detailed'

requests.name: Update Extension by ID
requests.description:
Modifies extension(s) by extension ID(s).

1. Updates the extension data:

    - status info
    - contact info
    - password/PIN
    - partnerId

2. Provisions unassigned extensions

examples.name: Example 1

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction for the result records. It is allowed to specify more than one direction. If not specified, both inbound and outbound records are returned. Multiple values are accepted

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Call type of a record. It is allowed to specify more than one type. If not specified, all call types are returned. Multiple values are accepted

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are allowed. Default value is '1'

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). If not specified, the value is '100' by default

parameters.name: syncType
parameters.description: Type of synchronization. The default value is 'FSync'

parameters.name: syncToken
parameters.description: Value of syncToken property of the last sync request response

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Number of records per page to be returned. The max number of records is 250, which is also the default. For FSync — if the number of records exceeds the parameter value (either specified or default), all of the pages can be retrieved in several requests. For ISync — if the number of records exceeds the page size, the number of incoming changes to this number is limited

parameters.name: pageId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a page. It can be obtained from the 'nextPageId' parameter passed in response body

response.name: records
response.description: List of contacts with synchronization information

response.name: nextPageId
response.description: Internal identifier of the next page, if any

response.name: nextPageUri
response.description: URL of the next page, if any

requests.name: Get Contact List
requests.description: Returns the extension address book.

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: Phone number in E.164 (11-digits) format with or without plus '+'. Multiple values are supported

parameters.name: startsWith
parameters.description: If specified, only contacts whose First name or Last name start with the mentioned substring are returned. Case-insensitive

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sorts results by the specified property. The default is 'First Name'

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are allowed. Default value is '1'

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). If not specified, the value is '100' by default

response.name: records
response.description: List of personal contacts from the extension address book

examples.name: Example

requests.name: Create Custom Answering Rule
requests.description: Creates a custom answering rule for a particular caller ID.

request.name: enabled
request.description: Specifies if the rule is active or inactive. The default value is 'True'

request.name: type
request.description: Type of an answering rule, the supported value is 'Custom'

request.name: name
request.description: Name of an answering rule specified by user. Max number of symbols is 30

request.name: callers
request.description: Answering rule will be applied when calls are received from the specified caller(s)

request.name: calledNumbers
request.description: Answering rule will be applied when calling the specified number(s)

request.name: schedule
request.description: Schedule when an answering rule should be applied

request.name: callHandlingAction
request.description: Specifies how incoming calls should be forwarded. The default value is 'ForwardCalls'

request.name: forwarding
request.description: Forwarding parameters. If the 'callHandlingAction' parameter value is set to 'ForwardCalls' - should be specified . The settings determine the forwarding numbers to which the call should be forwarded. If not specified in request, then the business-hours forwarding rules are set by default

request.name: unconditionalForwarding
request.description: Unconditional forwarding parameters. If the 'callHandlingAction' parameter value is set to 'UnconditionalForwarding' - should be specified

request.name: voiceMail
request.description: Specifies whether to take a voicemail and who should do it

requests.name: Get Extension Call Log

parameters.name: extensionNumber
parameters.description: Extension number of a user. If specified, returns call log for a particular extension only. Cannot be specified together with the phoneNumber filter

parameters.name: showBlocked
parameters.description: If 'True' then calls from/to blocked numbers are returned. The default value is 'True'

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: Phone number of a caller/call recipient. If specified, returns all calls (both incoming and outcoming) with the mentioned phone number. Cannot be specified together with the extensionNumber filter

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction for the result records. It is allowed to specify more than one direction. If not specified, both inbound and outbound records are returned. Multiple values are supported

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a call session. Cannot be specified along with parameters 'dateTo'/'dateFrom'

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Call type of a record. It is allowed to specify more than one type. If not specified, all call types are returned. Multiple values are supported

parameters.name: transport
parameters.description: Call transport type. By default this filter is disabled

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: The default value is 'Simple' for both account and extension call log

parameters.name: withRecording
parameters.description: 'True' if only recorded calls are returned. The default value is 'False'

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description: The end datetime for resulting records in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is current time

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description: The start datetime for resulting records in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is dateTo minus 24 hours

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are allowed. Default value is '1'

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). If not specified, the value is '100' by default

parameters.name: syncType
parameters.description: Type of synchronization. 'FSync' is a default value

parameters.name: syncToken
parameters.description: Value of syncToken property of last sync request response

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description: The start datetime for resulting records in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is the current moment

parameters.name: recordCount
parameters.description: For FSync the parameter is mandatory, it limits the number of records to be returned in response. For ISync it specifies with how many records to extend sync Frame to the past, the maximum number of records is 250

parameters.name: statusGroup
parameters.description: Type of calls to be returned. The default value is 'All'

response.name: records
response.description: List of call log records with synchronization information. For ISync the total number of returned records is limited to 250; this includes both new records and the old ones, specified by the recordCount parameter

requests.name: Delete Extension Call Log Record by ID
Get Extension Call Log Record by ID

request.name: from
request.description: Sender of a pager message. The extensionNumber property must be filled

request.name: replyOn
request.description: Internal identifier of a message this message replies to

request.name: text
request.description: Text of a pager message. Max length is 1024 symbols (2-byte UTF-16 encoded). If a character is encoded in 4 bytes in UTF-16 it is treated as 2 characters, thus restricting the maximum message length to 512 symbols

request.name: to
request.description: Optional if replyOn parameter is specified. Receiver of a pager message. The extensionNumber property must be filled

parameters.name: countryId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a country. If not specified, the response is returned for the brand country

request.name: phoneNumbers
request.description: Multiple dial-in phone numbers to connect to audio conference service, relevant for user's brand. Each number is given with the country and location information, in order to let the user choose the less expensive way to connect to a conference. The first number in the list is the primary conference number, that is default and domestic

request.name: allowJoinBeforeHost
request.description: Determines if host user allows conference participants to join before the host

request.name: to
request.description: Recipient information. Phone number property is mandatory. Optional for resend fax request

request.name: faxResolution
request.description: Fax resolution

request.name: sendTime
request.description: The datetime to send fax at, in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. If time is not specified, the fax will be send immediately

request.name: coverIndex
request.description: Optional. Cover page index. If not specified, the default cover page which is configured in "Outbound Fax Settings" is attached. See also 'Available Cover Pages' table below

request.name: coverPageText
request.description: Optional. Cover page text, entered by the fax sender and printed on the cover page. Maximum length is limited to 1024 symbols

request.name: originalMessageId
request.description: Internal identifier of the original fax message which needs to be resent. Mandatory for resend fax request

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are allowed. Default value is '1'

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). If not specified, the value is '100' by default

request.name: phoneNumber
request.description: Forwarding/Call flip phone number

request.name: label
request.description: Forwarding/Call flip number title

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are allowed. Default value is '1'

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). If not specified, the value is '100' by default

response.name: records
response.description: List of extension grants with the data

requests.name: Create Custom Greeting
requests.description: Creates extension user custom greeting.

request.name: type
request.description: Type of a greeting, specifying the case when the greeting is played. See also Greeting Types

request.name: answeringRule
request.description: Information on an answering rule that the greeting is applied to

examples.name: Example
examples.request:
POST /restapi/v1.0/account/1455897004/extension/1455897004/greeting HTTP/1.1
Authorization: Bearer U0pDMDFQMDFQQVMwMXxBQURIZjAzWFFySGpMMGxPaEhMaFR0
Content-Type: multipart/mixed;boundary=0123456789
Content-Length: 376

--0123456789
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="json"
Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

{
 "type": "Voicemail",
 "answeringRule": { "id": "2515566004" }
 }
--0123456789
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="binary"; filename="mygreeting.wav"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary
Content-Type: audio/wav

<...binary data...>

--0123456789--
examples.response:

requests.name: Get Extension Presence
requests.description:
Returns presence status of an extension or several extensions by their ID(s).

The presenceStatus is returned as Offline (the parameters telephonyStatus, message, userStatus and dndStatus are not returned at all) for the following extension types: Department/Announcement Only/Take Messages Only (Voicemail)/Fax User/Paging Only Group/Shared Lines Group/IVR Menu/Application Extension/Park Location.

If the user requests his/her own presence status, the response contains actual presence status even if the status publication is turned off.

Batch request is supported. For batch requests the number of extensions in one request is limited to 30. If more extensions are included in the request, the error code 400 Bad Request is returned with the logical error code InvalidMultipartRequest and the corresponding message 'Extension Presence Info multipart request is limited to 30 extensions'.

response.description: "True" if the number is in a special format (for example N11 code)

response.name: normalized
response.description: E.164 (11-digits) format of a phone number without the plus sign ('+')

response.name: country
response.description: Information on a country the phone number belongs to

requests.name: Look up Phone Number
requests.description: Returns the required numbers filtered by criteria.

parameters.name: areaCode
parameters.description: Area code of the location

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: Two-letter country code, complying with the ISO standard

parameters.name: countryId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a country; '1'- the US; '39' - Canada; '224' - the UK. The default value is '1'

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: A string of digits (one and more) that should not appear among the last four digits (line part) of the phone numbers that will be returned. It is possible to specify several exclude parameters. If specified, it is taken into account in all returned phone numbers both in the phone numbers satisfying to parameters of lookup and in alternative phone numbers (in case when extendedSearch is specified)

parameters.name: extendedSearch
parameters.description: If the value is 'False', then the returned numbers exactly correspond to the specified NXX, NPA and LINE or countryCode, areaCode and numberPattern parameters. If the value is 'True', then the resulting numbers are ranked and returned with the rank attribute values (1-10). The default value is 'False'

parameters.name: line
parameters.description: LINE pattern for vanity or wildcard search. Digits, Latin characters and asterisks are allowed (usually 4 characters)

parameters.name: numberPattern
parameters.description: Phone number pattern (for wildcard or vanity search). For NANP countries (US, Canada) is concatenation of nxx (the first three digits) and line. If the first three characters are specified as not digits (e.g. 5** or CAT) then parameter extendedSearch will be ignored.

parameters.name: nxx
parameters.description: NXX pattern for vanity or wildcard search. Digits, Latin characters and asterisks are allowed (usually 3 characters)

parameters.name: npa
parameters.description: Area code (mandatory). For example, 800, 844, 855, 866, 877, 888 for North America; and 647 for Canada

parameters.name: paymentType
parameters.description: Payment type. Default is 'Local' (it should correlate with the npa provided)

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). If not specified, the value is '10' by default

parameters.name: smsEnabled
parameters.description: Specifies if SMS activation is available for the number. If specified, it is taken into account in all returned phone numbers both in the phone numbers satisfying to parameters of lookup and in alternative phone numbers (in case when extendedSearch is specified). If not specified, the value is null.

response.name: uri
response.description: Canonical URI of the phone numbers resource

response.name: records
response.description: List of phone numbers filtered by the specified criteria

request.name: records
request.description: Phone numbers to be reserved/un-reserved

response.name: records
